title: Store UI Extensibility
content:
• Home
  • ››Administrator Tools
  • ››Manhattan ProActive®
  • ››User Interface Extensibility
  • ››Store UI Extensibility

Store UI Extensibility

  • Manage Store UI extensions from ProActive
    • HTML Layer Extensions 
    • TS Layer Extensions
      • Discovery Mode 
      • Navigation Extensions 

The Store UI supports customer-specific requirements where customers can extend the base user interface. The Store UI has pre-defined hooks in the form of simple and complex extensions. In simple extensions, customers can add attributes, buttons, custom menus, hide/disable the menu, etc., while the complex extensions allow customers to write their own logical code in between the base execution flows.

Manage Store UI extensions from ProActive

A UI developer creates a new Extension Pack in ProActive and selects the UI extensions option to navigate to the Store application. ProActive launches the Store application in the browser view with the Manhattan ProActive designer toolbar. The Store application URL is mapped with the extension pack ID and version number.

A UI developer can shift the Manhattan ProActive designer toolbar using the reposition icon. The help page/documentation for extension capabilities can be accessed by tapping the Help (?) icon.

Store UI allows users to add two types of extensions: 

  • HTML Layer Extensions 
  • TS Layer Extensions
Note: It is recommended to use the Proactive UI to navigate to the developer mode and not to use the "?developermode=true" added to the URL to access the extensions. 

HTML Layer Extensions 

The store UI shows the HTML layer extensions on the screens. A UI developer can invoke these extensions based on the organization's requirements.  

When adding a new extension, the extension popup window with the selected extension pack ID is shown below the screen ID. When adding the new extension on the screen, the extension gets mapped with an extension pack ID and is shown in the right-hand side panel under the selected section.   

If any other extensions are already deployed for the selected screen, then those extensions are shown in the deployed section on the right-hand side panel along with the extension pack ID. A UI developer can see these extension details but cannot do any modifications. Once the extensions have been added, clicking on the Save button saves the record in ProActive.

In the Manhattan ProActive designer toolbar, it enables the preview mode to view the actual representation of the extension.

TS Layer Extensions

Manhattan ProActive designer toolbar shows the “More” option where UI developers can see the list of inline extensions for the selected screen. Inline extensions which are not tied to any specific page are shown on the HOME page. The selected inline extension shows the business description and initiation steps, which are also saved in an ASCII doc file. In the inline extension popup, users have to enter the URL of the custom code to execute the inline extension. Adding resources for the inline extension is a non-mandatory field.

Note: UI developers can select only one Inline extension at a time.
Discovery Mode 

A UI developer can initiate the discovery mode from the inline extension developer mode popup. In discovery mode, they can see the initiation steps by tapping on the (i) icon. 

When a UI replicates the inline extension in the discovery mode, it shows the extended discovery mode developer popup. It allows users to learn more about the selected inline extension, including the business description, along with the function name, input, and output values. 

The input value shows data that has to be sent to the custom code, and the output value can be either a Boolean value or data object or fire and forget (i.e. no output). For fire and forget, the output will be shown as N/A. In discovery mode, users can copy the function name, input, and output values for future reference. The discovery mode option is available only in the browser and not on the devices.

Navigation Extensions 

Manhattan ProActive Designer shows the list of navigation extensions based on the store application screen. A UI developer can configure the base page navigation or custom page navigation using the navigation extension developer popup. 

For the base page navigation, users have to provide the base page ID; for custom page navigation, provide the custom page URL and title of the custom page. Adding titles for custom pages is an optional field. The UI would then navigate to the base or custom page when the navigation extension is executed.
